Review: You thought I could watch Casablanca and NOT follow up by watching Harry and Sally argue about it?

Oh my goodness, I’m so glad I finally watched this. Ingrid Bergman is just, well, there are no words. And seeing Humphrey Bogart say “we’ll always have Paris” on a big screen in a full audience on a snowy Sunday morning was just the loveliest thing. I can’t imagine what it must have been like watching this in 1942.
Didn’t expect to love but had fun! Only wish there’d been a mass dance number at the end.
“I’ve always wanted to live in a weird house, ever since I was a little boy!”

Movie: The Hunger Games: The Ballad of Songbirds & Snakes

Review: Cato’s speech hit hard this time 😭

Finally watched Anne and Emily’s full Actors on Actors so naturally had to rewatch to see my fav fashion moment of the film: Anne in a sweatshirt, fuming while wearing that headband with her cute bangs popping out the top 🥰
one star each for:(1) Rosamund Pike(2) cinematography (3) Jacob Elordi’s livestrong bracelet
